Completely stop a given package Kill all background processes associated with a given package Kill all processes that are safe to kill (cached, etc) Display the contents of a text file Change directory Go to root directory Go to home directory Go to previous directory Go to parent directory Clear terminal screen Copy a file Copy a file or directory Shows disk usage in human readable form Print activity info Print battery stats Change the level from 0 to 100 Change the level to unknown, charging, discharging, not charging or full Reset battery Print display stats Display message on screen Exit the shell Determine file type Search file(s) for lines that match a given pattern Kill a process by specifying its PID Display real-time log of system messages Displays current log buffer sizes Sets the buffer size (K or M) Clears the log buffers List contents of a directory List subdirectories recursively Print size of each file Create a directory Move a file or directory List TCP connectivity Test a network connection Delete all data associated with an app Only clear cache data associated with an app Only delete the data associated with a given user Disable a given package or component (written as package or class Disable an app Disable an app for a given user List info of one app List info of all apps Enable a given package or component (written as package or class Grant a permission to an app Hide an app from launcher Install an apk file Allow version code downgrade (debuggable packages only) Install application on internal flash Grant all runtime permissions Specify package name of installer owning the app Partial application install (new split on top of existing pkg) Update an existing apps, but disallow replacement of existing one Allow installing test packages Override the default ABI of the platform Install a new feature split without killing the running app Cause the app to be installed as a non-ephemeral full app Force the install location (Options, 0=auto, 1=internal only, 2=prefer external) Indicates why the app is being installed (Options, 0=unknown, 1=admin policy, 2=device restore,3=device setup, 4=user request) Cause the app to be installed as an ephemeral install app Don\'t whitelist restricted permissions at install Specify expected package name of app being installed Install for a given user Delete the given active install session Commit the given active install session, installing the app Create an install session Installs an existing application for a new user Install as a full app Install as an instant app Don\'t whitelist restricted permissions Install for a given user Wait until the package is installed Mark SPLIT(s) as removed in the given install session Write an apk into the given install session List phone features List all system libraries List package names List only third party packages List all known packages, but excluding APEXes List all disabled packages List all enabled packages List package names along with their associated file List package names along with their installer List only system packages List package names along with their version code List package names of all apps including the uninstalled ones List package names along with their package UID Print all known permission groups Print only dangerous permissions Print all information about the known permissions Organize all known permission by group Print a short summary about the known permissions Print only permissions that users will see List all user names Show apk file path of an app Revoke a permission from an app Reset permissions of an app Suspend an app. You won\'t be able to use a suspended app until you unsuspend it Unhide an app from launcher Uninstall an app Uninstall an app but keep the data and cache untouched Uninstall an app from a given user Only uninstall if the app has the given version code Removes updates to a given system application and falls back to its system version Unsuspend an app Print process status Print current working directory Reboot device Shutdown device Reboot device into recovery mode Reboot device into fastboot Reboot device into bootloader Delete a file Delete a file or directory List all services Delay for a specified time Synchronize data on disk with memory List processes running on the system Update display n times, then exit Print the current user id and name Displays current screen density Reset screen density to default Displays the current screen resolution Reset screen resolution to default
